TextView.android:text: How to set up the test

You're going to need an area which is 20 metres in length. This will be your 'shuttle' distance.
 
Find either somewhere outside, or a large space inside, like a gymnasium. If you're outside, make sure the ground is flat and free from obstructions.
 
Mark out the 20 metre distance using a tape measure, placing an easily-visible marker at each end. [Unfortunately, the GPS functionality of your phone or handheld device isn't accurate enough to be used as a way to make this measurement.]

Stand at one end of the shuttle you've marked out. When you start the app you'll hear three high-pitched bleeps followed by a fourth, lower-pitched bleep. On the fourth bleep the timer will start, and you'll start running.
 
You must reach the far end of the shuttle either before or on the next bleep. If you reach the far end before the next bleep, you must wait for the bleep before continuing.
 
After a certain number of shuttles you'll here a high-pitched bleep. This means you've moved up to the next level. The bleeps will now be closer together than before, meaning you'll have to run faster.
 
If you fail to reach the far end of the shuttle before the next bleep, and if this happens for two shuttles in a row, then your test is over and you must stop.
